## 판결문 요약


551 S.W.2d 602 (1977)
Albert L. BLEVINS and Linda Blevins, Plaintiffs-Respondents,
v.
CUSHMAN MOTORS, a Division of Outboard Marine Corp., a Corporation, Defendant-Appellant.
No. 59807.
Supreme Court of Missouri, en banc.
May 10, 1977.
Rehearing Denied June 14, 1977.
*605 Joseph A. Sherman, Kansas City, for defendant-appellant.
James S. Formby, Kansas City, for plaintiffs-respondents.
DONNELLY, Judge.
This is a products liability case. The facts of the case and that portion of this opinion which pertains to Cushman's first and second contentions on appeal (I and II) were written in this Court. The balance of the opinion was written by Judge Wasserstrom in the Court of Appeals and is adopted here, substantially as originally written, without quotation marks.
On the afternoon of July 15, 1969, plaintiff, Albert L. Blevins, and his occasional golfing partner and former co-worker, Kermit Maxwell, met to play golf at Stayton Meadows Golf Course. After splitting between them the rental cost of a three-wheeled golf cart manufactured by Cushman, the two men completed the first nine holes of an intended eighteen holes of golf.
*606 The first three holes of the back nine were played with the aid of the golf cart without incident.
